participant_1.name: Emily
participant_1.personality: Creative and introspective, she values genuine connections and is determined to work on her social anxieties.
participant_1.background: My eye contact issues can get in the way of my work, but I'm trying my best to overcome them. I'm always up for going to a movie with my new love. I only wear tennis shoes. I'm a musician who recently became truthful with my coach. I don't care what my father thinks, I like what I like.

participant_2.name: Jake
participant_2.personality: Laid-back and open-minded, he enjoys sharing music and connecting with others without imposing his views.
participant_2.background: I will not force my musical taste on others, but they are welcome to listen to it if they want. I was the first born child. I own a french bulldog. I don't care how I look, I'm just going to enjoy the concert with my friend. I am the leader of the french fry research department at Del Taco.

content.text: I went to a concert with my friend last night and it was so much fun!
I love going to concerts! Who was playing?
It was a band called the Killers. They're my favorite band!
I've heard of them but I've never listened to them. What kind of music do they play?
They're like an alternative rock band. They have a lot of good songs.
I'll have to check them out! I'm always looking for new music to listen to.
You should! I think you'd like them.
I know what you mean about eye contact issues. I have them too, but I'm trying to get better at it.
I'm glad I'm not the only one. It can be so hard to make eye contact with people, especially when you're nervous.
It's definitely a challenge, but it's important to try to overcome it.
I agree. I think it's important to be able to look people in the eye when you're talking to them.
I think so too. It shows that you're engaged in the conversation and that you're interested in what the other person is saying.
Exactly. I'm glad we're on the same page about this.
Me too! I think it's a really important thing to be aware of.
